dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey there, and welcome back! So, uh, big news from SpaceX this week, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey there, and welcome back! So, uh, big news from SpaceX this week, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, yeah! I saw that headline. They're, like, totally pulling out of their latest fundraising efforts. Pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yeah! I saw that headline. They're, like, totally pulling out of their latest fundraising efforts. Pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Billionaire Elon Musks rocket company SpaceX reportedly completed an $850 million fundraising round last week, as it looks to raise capital for its ambitious Starlink and Starship projects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Which, um, is kind of wild, given they had this massive round initially valued at $850 million, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Which, um, is kind of wild, given they had this massive round initially valued at eight hundred fifty million dollars, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Billionaire Elon Musks rocket company SpaceX reportedly completed an $850 million fundraising round last week...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Yeah, but then it got cancelled, according to CNBC. They're saying their big projects, Starlink and Starship, are, like, pretty much done.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but then it got cancelled, according to C N B C. They're saying their big projects, Starlink and Starship, are, like, pretty much done.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Billionaire Elon Musks rocket company SpaceX reportedly completed an $850 million fundraising round last week, as it looks to raise capital for its ambitious Starlink and Starship projects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's the word. And get this, the company's still gonna be valued around, uh, $74 billion. Even without that cash.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the word. And get this, the company's still gonna be valued around, uh, seventy four billion dollars. Even without that cash.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: News of the funding was first reported by CNBC, which said that the private company will now have a valuation of around $74 billion, citing people familiar with the financing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And didn't there used to be some drama around their share prices, too? Like, remember that infamous tweet?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And didn't there used to be some drama around their share prices, too? Like, remember that infamous tweet?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the *infamous* tweet! Yeah, they had originally priced new shares at $419.99, but then, uh, Musk's "going private at $420" tweet happened.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the infamous tweet! Yeah, they had originally priced new shares at four hundred nineteen dollars and ninety nine cents, but then, uh, Musk's going private at four hundred twenty dollars tweet happened.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company raised new funds at $419.99 per share, per CNBC. That price is just a cent below $420 per share, potentially a reference to Elon Musks notorious Twitter post in 2018, when he joked that he would take Tesla TSLA -2.3% private at $420 with funding secured.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, right. Just so, like, typically Musk. And speaking of him, his stake in SpaceX has really shifted, hasn't it? He used to own almost half.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, right. Just so, like, typically Musk. And speaking of him, his stake in SpaceX has really shifted, hasn't it? He used to own almost half.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Muskwho is the worlds second-richest person, behind Amazon AMZN +1.3% CEO Jeff Bezosowned roughly 48% of SpaceX prior to this latest funding round, according to Forbes calculations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he's, um, divested most of his shares. His stake is now, like, worth $32 billion. And his own net worth is down a bit too, by $12 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he's, um, divested most of his shares. His stake is now, like, worth thirty two billion dollars. And his own net worth is down a bit too, by twelve billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is not immediately clear if Musks ownership was diluted by the new round. If he managed to hold onto all 48%, his stake would now be worth about $32 billionup from roughly $20 billion previously, according to Forbes estimates. That would boost Musks net worth by $12 billion...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Still, uh, probably doing okay, I'd say. But it's interesting to see those shifts. I mean, SpaceX was only valued at $46 billion back in August 2020.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, uh, probably doing okay, I'd say. But it's interesting to see those shifts. I mean, SpaceX was only valued at forty six billion dollars back in August twenty twenty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: SpaceX was last valued at $46 billion in an August 2020 fundraising round.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and then Morgan Stanley came out with a, like, "pessimistic" $100 billion valuation just a couple months later. Huge jump.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and then Morgan Stanley came out with a, like, pessimistic one hundred billion dollar valuation just a couple months later. Huge jump.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But some Wall Street banks had put that value even higher: In October, a Morgan Stanley MS -1.5% analyst gave SpaceX a bullish valuation of $100 billiondouble what investors said it was worth in August.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, Starship. That's the one that's supposed to replace their older rockets, right? The Falcon 9s and Dragon spacecraft?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Starship. That's the one that's supposed to replace their older rockets, right? The Falcon nine seconds and Dragon spacecraft?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starship is the companys long-term spacecraft project, intended to eventually replace SpaceXs existing Falcon 9 rockets and Dragon spacecraft.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It's their big, uh, short-term project to get cargo, and eventually people, into space.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It's their big, uh, short-term project to get cargo, and eventually people, into space.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starship is the companys long-term spacecraft project, intended to eventually replace SpaceXs existing Falcon 9 rockets and Dragon spacecraft.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Starlink, too. That's the satellite internet constellation. I heard they were seeing, like, weak demand for that last year?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Starlink, too. That's the satellite internet constellation. I heard they were seeing, like, weak demand for that last year?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Beyond successfully launching U.S. astronauts into space in May of last year, SpaceX said in 2020 that it was seeing extraordinary demand for its Starlink satellite broadband service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, despite, um, you know, successfully launching astronauts. The goal is twelve thousand satellites, but early tests showed some, like, "inability to scale capacity."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, despite, um, you know, successfully launching astronauts. The goal is twelve thousand satellites, but early tests showed some, like, inability to scale capacity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The project aims to build an interconnected network of about 12,000 small satellites in low Earth orbit. So far, early tests have shown broadbands speeds capable of playing online video games and streaming movies, but the service faces criticism over its cost and the companys ability to scale capacity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. So, interesting timing to pull out of fundraising, but I guess they also did that internal transaction for insiders to buy more shares.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. So, interesting timing to pull out of fundraising, but I guess they also did that internal transaction for insiders to buy more shares.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition to raising money for its large-scale projects, SpaceX also completed a secondary transaction in which SpaceX insiders and investors were able to sell an additional $750 million worth of their shares, according to CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, the $750 million worth of shares. So, it's not like they're totally *without* new capital.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, the seven hundred fifty million dollars worth of shares. So, it's not like they're totally without new capital.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition to raising money for its large-scale projects, SpaceX also completed a secondary transaction in which SpaceX insiders and investors were able to sell an additional $750 million worth of their shares, according to CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely not. Always something happening with them, uh, it seems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely not. Always something happening with them, uh, it seems.
